Post Office Savings Account (SB) A Savings Account allows deposit and withdrawal of money during post office working hours and also 24x7 through ATM. Features: • Rate of Interest: 4% per annum (w.e.f. 01.01.2024) • Minimum opening deposit: ₹500 • Minimum subsequent deposit: ₹10 • Only one SB account can be opened by an individual • Interest is calculated on the minimum balance between the 10th and the last day of the month • Interest is credited at the end of the financial year Additional Facilities: • Cheque Book facility • ATM / Debit Card • Internet & Mobile Banking • Aadhaar Seeding • Atal Pension Yojana (APY) • Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY) • Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY) For more details please visit below https://www.indiapost.gov.in/banking-services/saving

Recurring Deposit (RD) A Recurring Deposit account is one where a fixed amount is deposited every month for a term of 5 years. Features: • Rate of Interest: 6.7% per annum (compounded quarterly) — w.e.f. 01.01.2024 • Minimum monthly deposit: ₹100 (in multiples of ₹10) • Tenure: 5 years • Subsequent deposit due date: - If the account is opened up to the 15th, deposit by the 15th of every month - If the account is opened from the 16th to the last working day, deposit by the last working day of every month Deposit / Default Rules: • If a monthly deposit is missed, a default charge of ₹1 per ₹100 denomination (pro-rata for other amounts) is applied for each defaulted month • After 4 regular defaults, the account becomes discontinued; it can be revived within 2 months from the 4th default • If not revived within this period, no further deposits can be made and the account remains discontinued • If there are not more than 4 defaults, the depositor may extend the maturity by the number of defaulted months and pay the missed installments during the extended period Loan / Closure / Extension: • After 12 installments and 1 year of continued (not discontinued) status, a loan up to 50% of the balance can be availed • Premature closure is allowed after 3 years from the date of opening (as per rules) • Account can be extended for a further 5 years on application; the interest rate during extension will be the original opening rate For more details please visit below https://www.indiapost.gov.in/banking-services/saving

Time Deposit (TD) / Fixed Deposit (FD) A Time Deposit account is one where a fixed amount is deposited for a period of 1, 2, 3, or 5 years. Rate of Interest (w.e.f. 01.01.2024): • 1 Year TD: 6.9% • 2 Year TD: 7.0% • 3 Year TD: 7.1% • 5 Year TD: 7.5% (Eligible for tax deduction under Section 80C) Features: • Any number of TD accounts can be opened • Minimum deposit: ₹1,000 (in multiples of ₹100) • No maximum deposit limit • Interest is paid annually / compounded quarterly (as per scheme rules) Maturity & Extension: • On maturity, the account may be extended for the same period for which it was originally opened Withdrawal & Security: • No withdrawal is allowed before 6 months from the date of deposit • TD account may be pledged/transferred as security to banks or other institutions by submitting the prescribed form along with acceptance letter For more details please visit below https://www.indiapost.gov.in/banking-services/saving

Monthly Income Scheme (MIS) A MIS account is a fixed deposit account where interest is paid every month. Features (w.e.f. 01.01.2024): • Rate of Interest: 7.4% per annum • Maximum investment limit: - ₹9,00,000 in a single account - ₹15,00,000 in a joint account • Interest is payable monthly, starting one month from the date of opening • Tenure: 5 years Closure: • Account can be closed after 5 years at the concerned Post Office by submitting the prescribed application form along with the passbook For more details please visit below https://www.indiapost.gov.in/banking-services/saving

Senior Citizen Savings Scheme (SCSS) A scheme for individuals aged 60+. Certain retirees under 60 are also eligible within 1 month of receiving retirement benefits (see eligibility below). Features (w.e.f. 01.01.2024): • Rate of Interest: 8.2% per annum (paid quarterly) • Minimum deposit: ₹1,000; in multiples of ₹1,000 • Maximum cumulative limit across all SCSS accounts per individual: ₹30,00,000 • Investment qualifies under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act, 1961 (subject to overall limit) • Interest payout quarters: 31 March, 30 June, 30 September, 31 December • Interest is taxable; if total SCSS interest in a financial year exceeds ₹50,000, TDS is deducted at the prescribed rate • No TDS if valid Form 15G/15H is submitted and the accrued interest is within the prescribed limit Eligibility (retirees below 60): • Retired civilian employees aged 55–<60: invest within 1 month of receipt of retirement benefits • Retired defence employees aged 50–<60: invest within 1 month of receipt of retirement benefits Tenure, Extension & Closure: • Tenure: 5 years • Extension: Once for a further 3 years by applying at the post office with passbook • Closure: Allowed after 5 years by submitting the prescribed application form with passbook at the concerned Post Office For more details please visit below https://www.indiapost.gov.in/banking-services/saving

Public Provident Fund (PPF) A PPF account can be opened by any resident individual to save for a fixed term of 15 years. Features: • Rate of Interest: 7.1% per annum (w.e.f. 01.01.2024) • Minimum deposit: ₹500 per financial year • Maximum deposit: ₹1,50,000 per financial year • Deposits qualify for deduction under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act, 1961 • If ₹500 is not deposited in a financial year, the account becomes discontinued (can be revived as per rules) • Loan can be taken after one year from the end of the FY in which the initial deposit was made Closure: • Account matures after 15 financial years (excluding the FY of opening) For more details please visit below https://www.indiapost.gov.in/banking-services/saving

Sukanya Samriddhi Account (SSA) An account that can be opened by a guardian in the name of a girl child below 10 years of age. Features (w.e.f. 01.01.2024): • Rate of Interest: 8.2% per annum • Only one SSA can be opened in India (Post Office or any bank) in the name of a girl child • Maximum two SSA accounts per family; in case of twin/triplet girl births, more than two accounts are allowed as per rules • Minimum deposit per financial year: ₹250 • Maximum deposit per financial year: ₹1,50,000 (in multiples of ₹50), in lumpsum or multiple instalments • Deposits qualify for deduction under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act • Deposit period: Up to completion of 15 years from the date of account opening • The account is operated by the guardian until the girl attains majority Closure / Maturity: • Account matures after 21 years from the date of opening • Premature closure allowed at the time of marriage of the girl child after she attains 18 years (as per rules) For more details please visit below https://www.indiapost.gov.in/banking-services/saving

Mahila Samman Saving Scheme A special savings scheme designed exclusively for women. Features (w.e.f. 01.01.2024): • Rate of Interest: 7.5% per annum (compounded quarterly) • Minimum deposit: ₹1,000 (in multiples of ₹100) • Maximum deposit limit: ₹2,00,000 across all accounts held by the individual • A gap of **3 months** must be maintained between opening a second account, if applicable • Up to **40% of the eligible balance** can be withdrawn after 1 year from the date of account opening Closure / Maturity: • Account matures **after 2 years**, and the eligible balance along with interest is paid to the depositor. For more details please visit below https://www.indiapost.gov.in/banking-services/saving

Kisan Vikas Patra (KVP) A savings certificate scheme where the invested amount doubles on maturity. Features (w.e.f. 01.01.2024): • Rate of Interest: 7.5% per annum • Maturity Period: 115 months (9 years and 7 months) — amount doubles • Minimum investment: ₹1,000 (in multiples of ₹100) • No maximum deposit limit • KVP certificates can be pledged or transferred as security by submitting the required form and acceptance letter at the concerned Post Office Closure / Maturity: • The deposit amount is paid on completion of the prescribed maturity period as per the rate applicable on the date of deposit. For more details please visit below https://www.indiapost.gov.in/banking-services/saving

Service Highlights:
• Cash on Delivery available • Free package pickup (for premium services) • SMS alerts for delivery status • Insurance options • Saturday delivery in major cities Rates calculator: Calculate Postage

Speed Post Services: • Delivery Time: 1-3 days (domestic) • Weight Limit: Up to 35kg • Tracking: Real-time online • Coverage: 1000+ cities • Special Services: - Cash on Delivery - Insurance - Pickup from premises • Rates: Starts from ₹35 for 50gm
Registered Post ensures a secure mailing with proof of booking and delivery. It's ideal for important documents or valuables. Each item gets a unique tracking number.
Money Order services allow you to send money safely to any post office location. The e-Money Order (eMO) is a fast, electronic option for transferring funds.
Parcel Service is designed for sending packages up to 35kg. Options include Business Parcel and Express Parcel, with online tracking and insurance available.

International Mail Services

• International Speed Post (EMS): Fastest service to 100+ countries (3–7 days).
• Air Mail: For letters and small packets (7–15 days).
• Surface Mail: Economy option for non-urgent parcels (1–3 months).
• Business Parcel: Suitable for bulk international shipping.

Important Guidelines:
• Customs declaration is mandatory for all parcels.
• Recommended insurance:
  - Documents: ₹10,000 free
  - Parcels: ₹5 per ₹100 value

Estimated Delivery Time (EMS):
• USA / UK: 5–7 days
• Middle East: 3–5 days

India Post offers a range of life insurance plans for government and private employees. These plans provide a high sum assured at low premiums. You can choose from Postal Life Insurance (PLI) or Rural Postal Life Insurance (RPLI).

Postal Life Insurance (PLI) started in 1884 for postal employees, later extending to telegraph employees. It's the country's oldest insurer, with over 50 million policies as of March 31, 2021. PLI now covers a wide range of individuals, including government employees, defense personnel, professionals, and employees of listed companies.

Types of PLI Schemes:
• Anticipated Endowment Assurance (Sumangal)
• Children Policy (Bal Jeevan Bima)
• Convertible Whole Life Assurance (Suvidha)
• Endowment Assurance (Santosh)
• Joint Life Assurance (Yugal Suraksha)
• Whole Life Assurance (Suraksha)

Rural Postal Life Insurance (RPLI) was introduced in 1995 to extend insurance coverage to rural India, addressing the low insurance penetration highlighted by the Malhotra Committee in 1993. Leveraging the extensive postal network and low operational costs, RPLI aims to provide insurance to rural populations, particularly targeting backward classes and women workers, while also spreading insurance awareness in rural areas.

Types of RPLI Schemes:
• 10 Years Rural PLI
• Anticipated Endowment Assurance (Gram Sumangal)
• Children Policy (Bal Jeevan Bima)
• Convertible Whole Life Assurance (Gram Suvidha)
• Endowment Assurance (Gram Santosh)
• Whole Life Assurance (Gram Suraksha)
